FADE IN: CLOSE ON A MASSIVE STEEL HEAD Our first thought: DR. DOOM?  But it's not moving.  A welder's torch sparks into frame in the hands of a sculptor on scaffolding.  This is art, an epic 20 foot statue going up of a business mogul (VICTOR VON DOOM) in whose generously extended hands sit two intertwined columns of DNA.  His face is chiseled, angular, perfect (too perfect).  Past sparks, we MOVE down to pick up... EXT. STREET/VON DOOM INDUSTRIES TOWER - DAY REED RICHARDS and BEN GRIMM head toward the soaring glass-box atrium of VDI Headquarters.  Designed to inspire awe, it does.

segments.content: High open space, exposed structural
elements.  Obviously aimed at first
time visitors to create feelings of...
smallness, inadequacy.
Ben glances at Reed, who looks a little nervous.
Good thing it ain't workin... Reed,
what are we doing here?  This guy's
fast-food, strip-mall science --
This wasn't our first stop, in case
you forgot NASA.  And Victor's not
that bad.  He's just a little...
(seeing the statue)
INT. VON DOOM INDUSTRIES TOWER - DAY They move past the statue, into the sprawling atrium.

dialogue.text: INT. VON DOOM INDUSTRIES TOWER - DAY They move past the statue, into the sprawling atrium.

segments.content: He's financed some of the biggest
breakthroughs of this century.

He motions to a high-tech ORB, showing FOOTAGE of VDI's accomplishments: a safe and clean nuclear facility, the first private Space Station. All images have VICTOR front and center, glad-handling George Bush, Tony Blair, shady International Leaders.  The last image is Victor holding the AMERICA'S CUP.

dialogue.text: He motions to a high-tech ORB, showing FOOTAGE of VDI's accomplishments: a safe and clean nuclear facility, the first private Space Station. All images have VICTOR front and center, glad-handling George Bush, Tony Blair, shady International Leaders.  The last image is Victor holding the AMERICA'S CUP.

segments.content: They reach three stern RECEPTIONISTS.

dialogue.text: They reach three stern RECEPTIONISTS.

segments.content: A receptionist cuts him off, handing them each a pass.

character.name: Reed Richards and Ben Grimm to see --

dialogue.text: A receptionist cuts him off, handing them each a pass.

segments.content: Executive elevator, top floor.

They head for the elevator.  Reed carries a small, black box. As they enter the elevator, steel doors shut and we CUT TO -- INT. VON DOOM INDUSTRIES TOWER - OFFICE - DAY A large, dark office.  Ben in the corner.  He yawns, watches... BRIGHT HOLOGRAMS: Stars.  Planets.  They hover in the air, making the room feel like a majestic portal into outer space.

character.name: What's the price for a smile round here?

dialogue.text: They head for the elevator.  Reed carries a small, black box. As they enter the elevator, steel doors shut and we CUT TO -- INT. VON DOOM INDUSTRIES TOWER - OFFICE - DAY A large, dark office.  Ben in the corner.  He yawns, watches... BRIGHT HOLOGRAMS: Stars.  Planets.  They hover in the air, making the room feel like a majestic portal into outer space.

segments.content: My research suggests that exposure to
a high-energy cosmic storm born on
solar winds might have triggered the
evolution of early planetary life.
REED stands among the holograms, speaking to a MYSTERIOUS
FIGURE in shadow behind a desk.  An ominous, PULSATING RED
CLOUD covers the stars.  It washes over a hologram of EARTH.
In six weeks another cloud with the
same elemental profile will pass
Earth's orbit.  A study in space could
advance our knowledge about the
structure of the human genome, and
help cure countless diseases, extend
human life --
The SHADOW clears his throat.  Reed speeds up, emotional.
Give kids the chance to be stronger,
healthier, less prone to --
The figure's DEEP VOICE pierces the darkness.

dialogue.text: The figure's DEEP VOICE pierces the darkness.

segments.content: But I haven't fully explained my --
Yes you have... Imagination.
Creativity.  Passion.  Those were
always your trademarks.
Lights brighten, revealing the face behind the voice: VICTOR
VON DOOM.  35, handsome, commanding.  He looks almost...
airbrushed.  He drops a WIRED magazine to the desk.  REED is
on the cover over the words: RICHARDS BANKRUPT, GRANT
But dreams don't pay the bills, do
they?
(a condescending smile)
Same old Reed, the hopeless optimist.
Still reaching for the stars, with the
world on your back.
You remember in school we talked about
working together.  That's what I was
about to explain...
Reed presses the remote.  Another hologram appears: A SHUTTLE
slowly approaching AN ORBITING SPACE STATION.  Both bear the
VON DOOM INDUSTRIES logo.  Victor smiles, more intrigued.
So it's not my money you want.  It's
my toys... Tell me: if NASA doesn't
trust you, why should I?
Victor is a step ahead.  Reed pauses, thrown for a beat.  Ben
wakes up, suspicious.  Victor notices.  He notices
everything.
That's my job.  To stay a step ahead.
Ben gets close to Reed, turning toward the door.

character.name: To know what other men don't.

dialogue.text: Ben gets close to Reed, turning toward the door.

segments.content: I can't take this.
(low, quiet)
A beat.  Victor cracks a smile, enjoying the tension.  And...

character.name: Ben.  This is business.  Just work.

dialogue.text: A beat.  Victor cracks a smile, enjoying the tension.  And...

segments.content: They turn to see...SUE STORM (demure, stunning) standing in a corner...possibly for the whole presentation.  A little cold:

dialogue.text: They turn to see...SUE STORM (demure, stunning) standing in a corner...possibly for the whole presentation.  A little cold:

segments.content: It's just business.
I think you both know my Director of
Genetic Research, Susan Storm.
Heya Susie.
(under breath, to Reed)
Sue gracefully walks into the office, only taking her eyes off of Reed to give Ben a warm hug.

dialogue.text: Sue gracefully walks into the office, only taking her eyes off of Reed to give Ben a warm hug.

segments.content: She gives Reed a polite handshake.  Victor watches carefully. Reed looks uncomfortable in her gaze.  A little tongue-tied.

dialogue.text: She gives Reed a polite handshake.  Victor watches carefully. Reed looks uncomfortable in her gaze.  A little tongue-tied.

segments.content: You're, you've, I mean, how have you
bee--
Victor sizes them up.  He puts a hand on Sue's shoulder.

dialogue.text: Victor sizes them up.  He puts a hand on Sue's shoulder.

segments.content: This isn't going to be a problem, is
it?
Not at all.
Victor smiles, eyeing Sue.

dialogue.text: Victor smiles, eyeing Sue.

segments.content: Good.  Then you're just in time to
hear the great Reed Richards ask me
for help.
(to Reed)
You know, you made a lot of folks at
MIT feel like a junior high science
fair.  So you'll excuse me if I savor
the moment.
Ben tightens.  A hard beat.  Reed sucks it up.
You back this mission, and I'll sign
over a fair percentage of any
applications or --
The number's seventy-five.  And it's
applications and patents.
What about his first born?
(quiet)
Ben, the money's not important.  We
could save lives.
Sue gives a thin smile -- a flicker of old feelings.
Twenty-five percent of a billion is
enough to keep the lights on, isn't
it?  Maybe even pay off your fourth
mortgage on the Baxter Building.
They look at Victor.  How does he know all this...?
Reed looks at Ben, who shakes his head softly no.  But Reed...drops a nod.  Done.  Victor smiles, offers a handshake.

dialogue.text: Reed looks at Ben, who shakes his head softly no.  But Reed...drops a nod.  Done.  Victor smiles, offers a handshake.

segments.content: Victor squeezes.  Hard.  His other hand on Sue's shoulder.

character.name: Well then, to our future.  Together.

dialogue.text: Victor squeezes.  Hard.  His other hand on Sue's shoulder.

segments.content: Funny how things turn out, isn't it?
As Reed and Sue lock eyes, Ben watches Victor.  Wary. INT. VICTOR'S OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER - DAY Director of Communications LEONARD enters, checking files.

dialogue.text: As Reed and Sue lock eyes, Ben watches Victor.  Wary. INT. VICTOR'S OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER - DAY Director of Communications LEONARD enters, checking files.

segments.content: If Reed's right, then this little trip
will double our stock offering.
And if he's not...?
Reed's always right.  Good thing he
doesn't always know what he's got...

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM INDUSTRIES TOWER - ELEVATOR - MOMENTS LATER

segments.content: Reed and Ben step into the elevator.
He knew about NASA.  What if he made
the call to shut us down --
Ben, think about all the people we can
help if this works --
Maybe you should think about yourself
for once.  You always let this guy
push you round --
We got what we wanted.  That's
enough.
I know, I know.  I'm just worried
about what he wants... Speaking of
which...
Reed follows Ben's eyes to...SUE.  She joins them.  Doors
shut.

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM INDUSTRIES STAIRCASE - CONTINUOUS

segments.content: He nods, head down.  He doesn't want eye contact.

dialogue.text: He nods, head down.  He doesn't want eye contact.

segments.content: Those solar winds are flaring, but I
factored them into my coordinates and --
I was talking about us.  Working
together.
Sue holds her eyes on Reed.  He is clearly uncomfortable in
her gaze.  Did the elevator just get smaller?
(thinking, talking fast)
Well, uh, based on our history...you
can handle the biogenetics, and I'll
focus on the molecular physics.  Or,
uhm, maybe I should take the biotech,
you work the microscopes, since you
have some background in electropho--
(droll, a little annoyed)
She shakes her head -- same old Reed.  He looks at her -- what did he say wrong?  Ben smiles, patting Reed on the shoulder.

character.name: Right.  That's exactly what I meant.

dialogue.text: She shakes her head -- same old Reed.  He looks at her -- what did he say wrong?  Ben smiles, patting Reed on the shoulder.

segments.content: Way to not overthink it.
(to Sue)
So when do we leave?
I'll schedule the launch.  Call me in
the morning to talk about resources
and crew.
She offers a business card.  Reed doesn't take it.
I, uh, think I remember the number.
Beat.  Ben grimaces.  Reed takes the card, his eyes down.

dialogue.text: Beat.  Ben grimaces.  Reed takes the card, his eyes down.

segments.content: As far as crew, I was hoping Ben could
pilot the mission --

heading.subject: Well, he's welcome to ride shotgun,
heading.raw_text: Well, he's welcome to ride shotgun,

segments.content: but we already have a pilot on our
payroll.  You remember my brother

Off Ben's curdling smile, we DISSOLVE TO -- EXT. LAKE LAUNCH FACILITY - DAY A helicopter shot through trees.  We soar over timberland, and find something massive looming on the horizon: A SPACECRAFT.  A sleek take on a space shuttle.  Modern tech combined with industrial design that NASA could never afford. The craft's nose is pointed straight up, ready for launch. WORKERS IN JUMPSUITS are scattered around the two-hundred foot tall scaffolding, performing routine checks. EXT. GANTRY OVERLOOK - DAY Ben stares up at the craft.  A sneer on his face.

We soar over timberland, and find something massive looming on the horizon: A SPACECRAFT.  A sleek take on a space shuttle.  Modern tech combined with industrial design that NASA could never afford. GANTRY OVERLOOK - DAY Ben stares up at the craft.  A sneer on his face.

segments.content: Can't do it.  I cannot do it.
External SRBs, orbital system engines.
Its just like the shuttles you flew
in --
No.  I cannot take orders from that
underwear model.  That wingnut washed
out of NASA for sneaking two Victoria
Secret wannabes into a flight
simulator.
They walk toward the base of the scaffolding.

dialogue.text: They walk toward the base of the scaffolding.

segments.content: They crashed it into a wall.  A flight
simulator.

CLOSE on JOHNNY STORM, leaning over to kiss a hot redhead. PULL BACK TO REVEAL he's riding a MOTORCYCLE, and she's driving a red CORVETTE with license plate: FRANKIE.  PICK UP Reed and Ben, watching through binoculars.

character.name: I'm sure he's matured since then.

dialogue.text: CLOSE on JOHNNY STORM, leaning over to kiss a hot redhead. PULL BACK TO REVEAL he's riding a MOTORCYCLE, and she's driving a red CORVETTE with license plate: FRANKIE.  PICK UP Reed and Ben, watching through binoculars.

segments.content: When have I asked you to do something
you absolutely said you could not do?
Five times.
I had it at four.
INT. LAKE LAUNCH FACILITY LOCKER ROOM - NIGHT Reed and Ben unpack gear into lockers.  Suddenly --

dialogue.text: INT. LAKE LAUNCH FACILITY LOCKER ROOM - NIGHT Reed and Ben unpack gear into lockers.  Suddenly --

segments.content: Ben goes to attention on reflex: Johnny snaps a picture with a digital camera.  Then advances, as Ben realizes who it is...

dialogue.text: Ben goes to attention on reflex: Johnny snaps a picture with a digital camera.  Then advances, as Ben realizes who it is...

segments.content: Digital camera: $254.  Memory stick:
$59.  The look on your hard-ass former
CO's grill when he finds out he's your
junior officer: priceless.
Ben eyeballs Johnny, suddenly reaches up as if to grab him.
Johnny flinches.  But Ben just reaches for Johnny's zipper,
adjusts his uniform.
I can handle the ship.  I can even
handle Mr. Blonde Ambition.  But I
don't know if I should be flying or
playing Vegas in these suits.  Who the
hell came up with them?
Sue enters, wearing her blue, wetsuit-like uniform, carrying a stack of flightsuits.  She hands them out to the guys.

dialogue.text: Sue enters, wearing her blue, wetsuit-like uniform, carrying a stack of flightsuits.  She hands them out to the guys.

segments.content: The synthetics act as a second skin,
adapting to your individual needs to --
Keep the hot side hot, and the cool
side cool!
Reed stares at Sue in the skintight outfit.  She wonders, maybe hopes -- is he actually checking her out?

dialogue.text: Reed stares at Sue in the skintight outfit.  She wonders, maybe hopes -- is he actually checking her out?

segments.content: Material made from self-regulating
unstable molecules.  I've been working
on a formula for this.
Great minds think alike.
Victor enters, wearing his custom-tailored flightsuit.

character.name: Guess some think faster than others.

dialogue.text: Victor enters, wearing his custom-tailored flightsuit.

segments.content: I hired Armani to design the pattern.
These colors will look great on
camera.
A DOOR OPENS.  Leonard enters, in a sharp suit.
They're ready for you, sir.
EXT. LAKE LAUNCH FACILITY - HALLS - NIGHT Leonard leads Victor through the halls.  Victor checks himself in mirrors as he walks, fixing his hair, his uniform.

dialogue.text: EXT. LAKE LAUNCH FACILITY - HALLS - NIGHT Leonard leads Victor through the halls.  Victor checks himself in mirrors as he walks, fixing his hair, his uniform.

segments.content: Our numbers are through the roof.  The
IPO's tracking at fifty, sixty a
share.  The bank's five times
oversubscribed --
It's not just the money.  I could make
money in my sleep.
Then what is it?
History, Leonard.  History.
Everything else is conversation...
(a beat)
Leonard pulls out a BOX.  Opens it: a TEN KARAT DIAMOND RING.

dialogue.text: Leonard pulls out a BOX.  Opens it: a TEN KARAT DIAMOND RING.

segments.content: They hit a set of big doors.  Victor stops and looks into the reflective, metallic surface on the wall.  He fixes one last strand of hair.  Perfect. Then he opens the door to... SNAP!SNAP!SNAP!  WHIP-PAN a row of CAMERAS snapping shots of -- EXT. LAKE LAUNCH FACILITY - NIGHT Retrofitted into a makeshift press area.  Victor sits on a platform, with reporters stretched out below him.

dialogue.text: They hit a set of big doors.  Victor stops and looks into the reflective, metallic surface on the wall.  He fixes one last strand of hair.  Perfect. Then he opens the door to... SNAP!SNAP!SNAP!  WHIP-PAN a row of CAMERAS snapping shots of -- EXT. LAKE LAUNCH FACILITY - NIGHT Retrofitted into a makeshift press area.  Victor sits on a platform, with reporters stretched out below him.

segments.content: Today we stand on the edge of a new
frontier.  In the furthest depths of
outer space...we will find the secrets
to inner space.  The final key to
unlocking our genetic code lies in a
cosmic storm...
BEHIND THE ACTION: Reed, Sue, Johnny and Ben walk past.  News
crews barely notice, passing without even taking a picture.
Our "Fantastic Four" are not exactly big news.  Not yet.
Isn't that your speech?
He's made a few changes.
This is your dream, Reed.  You should
be the one up there.

Just past the press area, they see...one woman standing, waiting.  This is DEBBIE, Ben's fiancee.  And for the first time in the entire film...Ben SMILES.  They hug, kissing. Johnny and Reed watch.  Reed glances at Sue, who walks ahead. Debbie slips a photo into Ben's flightsuit.  A tender beat.

dialogue.text: Just past the press area, they see...one woman standing, waiting.  This is DEBBIE, Ben's fiancee.  And for the first time in the entire film...Ben SMILES.  They hug, kissing. Johnny and Reed watch.  Reed glances at Sue, who walks ahead. Debbie slips a photo into Ben's flightsuit.  A tender beat.

segments.content: I'll be watching over you.
Just get back soon, or I start looking
for a new groom.
Ben looks at the little ENGAGEMENT RING on her finger.
Soon as I'm back, I'm gonna trade that
in for a bigger rock.
I don't care about rocks, I care about
you.
(to Reed)
You bring him back in one piece, or
you can forget being Best Man.
Reed nods, smiles.  Debbie gives Ben a last kiss.  Ben turns
to Johnny, who gives a cocky smile.
What the hell you smiling at?  Just
keep your mouth shut, and your mind on
those SMBs --
Actually, the engines are SMEs.
Hydrogenbase, carbon propellant.
Couple generations past your last
ride.
(at the threshold)

Ben just glares at Reed.  This is going to be a long trip. As they follow after Sue, we CUT BACK TO -- VICTOR ON STAGE Mid-speech.  Playing behind him is REED'S HOLOGRAM: stars give way to a pulsating red cloud...

character.name: I'm not as dumb as you look.

dialogue.text: Ben just glares at Reed.  This is going to be a long trip. As they follow after Sue, we CUT BACK TO -- VICTOR ON STAGE Mid-speech.  Playing behind him is REED'S HOLOGRAM: stars give way to a pulsating red cloud...

segments.content: Think of a world without genetic flaws
-- no asthma, allergies, baldness,
breast cancer...
Ben and Reed hear the speech.  Ben bristles.
Victor smiles at the crowd, commanding.  A true leader.

dialogue.text: Victor smiles at the crowd, commanding.  A true leader.

segments.content: Darwin discovered evolution.  Now we --
I -- will define it.  Only in America
could...
The red cloud of cosmic rays wash over the Earth.
...a little country boy from Latveria
build one of the biggest companies in
the world, and truly reach the stars.
Now if you'll excuse me, history
awaits...
On those words, the HOLOGRAM TRANSFORMS TO...Von Doom's
SHUTTLE on the launch pad.  BOOM!  THRUSTERS FIRE WHITE HOT.
Smoke billows across the pad.  Ready for take off.
Victor walks past the hologram and exits.  His departure
perfectly timed with the shuttle LIFTING OFF.
We push in on the shuttle, and follow the ship as it leaves
Earth's atmosphere.  BOOM -- booster rockets fall away and
the shuttle fires its thrusters.  The hologram transitions
to...

heading.subject: A shot of the SPACE STATION high above the Earth.  The
heading.raw_text: A shot of the SPACE STATION high above the Earth.  The

segments.content:
shuttle enters from the top, lighting up the hologram with

               engines afire.  As the shuttle approaches the station we CUT

THE SPACE STATION in the distance, rotating in orbit above

               Earth.  THE SHUTTLE eases in and docks.

heading.raw_text: INT. SPACE STATION - COMMAND CENTER - SAME

segments.content: Victor and Sue lead the others into the command center.
(a "dad voice": to Ben)
If you behave, maybe next time
daddy'll let you drive.
Keep talking, there won't be a next
time.
Reed is focused on THE EARTH.
Long way from the projection booth at
the Hayden Planetarium, isn't it?
Reed turns towards her -- a little stunned that she would
bring that up.  It's the first time she's been nice to him so
far.  He smiles, gently, hesitantly, always hesitant with
Sue.

Johnny and Ben exchange a look.  Reed keeps looking at the stars, eyes wide, like a little kid. INT. SPACE STATION - COMMAND CENTER/OBSERVATION DECK - SAME They enter the nerve center of the space station.  Victor goes to a computer console on the observation deck below. The windows are closed, so there's nothing to observe.

dialogue.text: Johnny and Ben exchange a look.  Reed keeps looking at the stars, eyes wide, like a little kid. INT. SPACE STATION - COMMAND CENTER/OBSERVATION DECK - SAME They enter the nerve center of the space station.  Victor goes to a computer console on the observation deck below. The windows are closed, so there's nothing to observe.

segments.content: (to ground; via comm-link)
Leonard, how's the feed?
Victor glances at a camera mounted into the console.

character.name: Recording, sir.  We see you perfectly.

dialogue.text: Victor glances at a camera mounted into the console.

segments.content: We can monitor the cloud's approach
and observe the tests from here.
Is it safe?
The shields on the station should
protect us.
Should?
What's wrong, Ben?  Eighty-million
dollars worth of equipment not enough
for you?
Let's start loading those samples.
Victor keeps his eyes on Ben.

dialogue.text: Victor keeps his eyes on Ben.

segments.content: Victor gives a friendly smile, patting Reed.

character.name: So you still do all the heavy lifting?

dialogue.text: Victor gives a friendly smile, patting Reed.

segments.content: Maybe you should have stayed back in
the lab.  Field work never suited you.
Reed doesn't defend himself.  Ben steps up.
He does the talking.  I do the
walking.  Got it?
Victor holds tight to his smile.  He nods, condescending.
Got it.  So take a walk, Ben...I'm
going to borrow Susan for a second.

Ben and Johnny read his eyes, as we CUT TO -- INT. SPACE STATION - AIR LOCK - LATER Ben preps for a space walk, putting on a helmet and boots. Johnny unloads a set of clear sample boxes off of a cart, each containing a variety of plants.

dialogue.text: Ben and Johnny read his eyes, as we CUT TO -- INT. SPACE STATION - AIR LOCK - LATER Ben preps for a space walk, putting on a helmet and boots. Johnny unloads a set of clear sample boxes off of a cart, each containing a variety of plants.

segments.content: Please tell me your dawg's not trying
to rekindle things with my sister.
'Course not.  Strictly business.
Yeah, well, his eyes say different.
Hey, two hearts got busted last time.
Maybe she's not over it either.
Let's see: you got Victor, stud of the
year, more coin than God?  Or Reed,
the world's dumbest smart guy worth
less than a postage stamp.  Hmmm, it's
a toss-up.
Put your tiny little mind at ease.

Johnny steps out of the air-lock and shuts the door.  He looks through a small window to see Ben give the thumbs up. THE AIRLOCK DOOR opens, and Ben gracefully steps into space. INT. SPACE STATION - OBSERVATION DECK - SAME TIME Sue descends the stairs at Victor's behest.  Joins him.

dialogue.text: Johnny steps out of the air-lock and shuts the door.  He looks through a small window to see Ben give the thumbs up. THE AIRLOCK DOOR opens, and Ben gracefully steps into space. INT. SPACE STATION - OBSERVATION DECK - SAME TIME Sue descends the stairs at Victor's behest.  Joins him.

segments.content: Surprised I agreed to Reed's proposal?
I understand the business reasons.
Well, when you're looking at your
future, it never hurts to find closure
about the past.
Sue's eyes narrow.  What is this about...?
Susan, every man dreams that he'll
meet some woman he can give the world
to.
He presses a button and the observation deck's outer windows
open up, revealing a spectacular, romantic view of the EARTH.

While she stares out the window, Victor reaches into a pocket, revealing a RING BOX.  Sue looks unsettled. INT. SPACE STATION - NEARBY CORRIDOR - SAME TIME Reed checks data on a work station, set on a wall.  The results of his calculations are not what he expected... He sees WIND VELOCITY digits rise.  He does a double-take when he sees the readout: EVENT THRESHOLD, T-MINUS 10:00.

character.name: In my case, it's not just a metaphor.

dialogue.text: While she stares out the window, Victor reaches into a pocket, revealing a RING BOX.  Sue looks unsettled. INT. SPACE STATION - NEARBY CORRIDOR - SAME TIME Reed checks data on a work station, set on a wall.  The results of his calculations are not what he expected... He sees WIND VELOCITY digits rise.  He does a double-take when he sees the readout: EVENT THRESHOLD, T-MINUS 10:00.

segments.content: No...no...impossible.  It's...too
fast.

heading.raw_text: INT. SPACE STATION - OBSERVATION DECK - SAME TIME

segments.content: Behind his back, Victor holds the ring box in hand.
Sue doesn't know where this is going.  She treads lightly.

character.name: You've been with me two years now.

dialogue.text: Sue doesn't know where this is going.  She treads lightly.

segments.content: It's been a good two years, Victor...
The company's accomplished so much.
Right, of course, the company... But
you see, I've come to realize all the
accomplishments in the world mean
nothing without someone to share them
with --
Uh, Victor, I hope I haven't done
something to make you think...
Sue, I've lived my life unafraid of
taking big steps.  And this is the
biggest step yet.  If it helps, think
of this as a promotion.  A merger of
sorts...
(getting closer)
Four little words that can change our
lives...
He is about to spring the ring on her.  She looks like a deer
in headlights.  She opens her mouth, and...WHAM!  Doors slam
open.  REED RUSHES INTO THE ROOM.
Victor quickly puts the ring back in his pocket.

dialogue.text: Victor quickly puts the ring back in his pocket.

segments.content: Sue quickly moves to a nearby control panel to verify Reed's claim.  Starts punching buttons.  Confirms Reed's findings with a nod.  Victor hardens, in control.

dialogue.text: Sue quickly moves to a nearby control panel to verify Reed's claim.  Starts punching buttons.  Confirms Reed's findings with a nod.  Victor hardens, in control.

segments.content: We've got minutes until it hits, not
hours...Victor, that storm's deadly --
the radiation's lethal.  We need to
abort.
Get a grip.  Reed.  We didn't come all
this way to lose our nerve at the
first little glitch.  Just close the
shields...
Ben's still out there --
So reel him in.  But we came here to
do a job.  So let's do it.  Quickly.
Ben is carefully arranging SAMPLE BOXES OF PLANTS.
Ben turns to see Reed and Johnny staring from a window.

character.name: Ben, we need you back inside.

dialogue.text: Ben turns to see Reed and Johnny staring from a window.

segments.content: I ain't done arranging your flowers,
egghead.
Ben sees Johnny motioning for Ben to look behind him.  Ben turns and sees: THE COSMIC STORM, rumbling toward the station.  Not close, but not far.  That gets Ben's attention.

character.name: Ben.  This is serious.  Turn around.

dialogue.text: Ben sees Johnny motioning for Ben to look behind him.  Ben turns and sees: THE COSMIC STORM, rumbling toward the station.  Not close, but not far.  That gets Ben's attention.

segments.content: He turns back towards the ship.  BEHIND HIM, the storm grows. INT. SPACE STATION - COMMAND CENTER - SAME TIME Victor rushes into the room, looks at the monitors.  Sees the others near the airlock on one screen, and the approaching cloud on another.  Anxiety creeps across his face.

dialogue.text: He turns back towards the ship.  BEHIND HIM, the storm grows. INT. SPACE STATION - COMMAND CENTER - SAME TIME Victor rushes into the room, looks at the monitors.  Sees the others near the airlock on one screen, and the approaching cloud on another.  Anxiety creeps across his face.

segments.content: INT. SPACE STATION - AIRLOCK DOOR - SAME TIME Reed and Johnny stand by the airlock, waiting for Ben.  They heard the automated voice.  It panics Reed.

dialogue.text: INT. SPACE STATION - AIRLOCK DOOR - SAME TIME Reed and Johnny stand by the airlock, waiting for Ben.  They heard the automated voice.  It panics Reed.

segments.content: Come on, Ben, come on...

EXT. OUTER SPACE - MOMENTS LATER A wake of turbulence from the cloud hits Ben, making it harder to maneuver.  The cloud's tendrils snake toward him. INT. SPACE STATION - AIRLOCK DOOR - SAME TIME They can see Ben outside the window, still twenty yards away. The entire corridor rumbles.  Lights flicker and spark.  They watch helplessly. INT. SPACE STATION - COMMAND CENTER/OBSERVATION DECK - SAME Sue watches the monitor, also helpless.

character.name: Reed, we're running out of time.

dialogue.text: EXT. OUTER SPACE - MOMENTS LATER A wake of turbulence from the cloud hits Ben, making it harder to maneuver.  The cloud's tendrils snake toward him. INT. SPACE STATION - AIRLOCK DOOR - SAME TIME They can see Ben outside the window, still twenty yards away. The entire corridor rumbles.  Lights flicker and spark.  They watch helplessly. INT. SPACE STATION - COMMAND CENTER/OBSERVATION DECK - SAME Sue watches the monitor, also helpless.

segments.content: Victor, annoyed by the indecisiveness, marches right up to Sue.  Practically shoves her aside as he hits the INTERCOM.

dialogue.text: Victor, annoyed by the indecisiveness, marches right up to Sue.  Practically shoves her aside as he hits the INTERCOM.

segments.content: Reed, you need to get up here so we
can close the shields!  Now!
Sue glares at Victor.  His lack of compassion shocks her.
Not until Ben is back inside!
It's too late for him, and soon it'll
be too late for all of us.
Victor doesn't bother to wait for a response.  He takes over
the console, punching keys.
What are you doing?
Raising the shields.
Sue glares with as much contempt as her face can muster.

character.name: You can't leave them out there.

dialogue.text: Sue glares with as much contempt as her face can muster.

segments.content: Watch me.  Reed had his chance.  You
can't help them any more than I can.
Beat.  She takes a step toward the door.  Not sure what to
do.
With one final glare, she bolts from the room. INT. SPACE STATION - AIRLOCK DOOR - SAME TIME Reed bites his lip.  Thinks.  He decides.

dialogue.text: With one final glare, she bolts from the room. INT. SPACE STATION - AIRLOCK DOOR - SAME TIME Reed bites his lip.  Thinks.  He decides.

segments.content: Victor's right.  Johnny, get to the
command center.  Close the shields.
One look from Reed tells Johnny, he won't leave without Ben. Johnny eyes Ben, steels his courage.  He's not going either.

dialogue.text: One look from Reed tells Johnny, he won't leave without Ben. Johnny eyes Ben, steels his courage.  He's not going either.

segments.content: (to Ben)
INT. SPACE STATION COMMAND CENTER - DAY Victor watches the shields slide down.  Alone.  An island.

character.name: Come on big guy, you can do it!

dialogue.text: INT. SPACE STATION COMMAND CENTER - DAY Victor watches the shields slide down.  Alone.  An island.

segments.content: INT. SPACE STATION - CORRIDOR - SAME TIME Sue races down the hall.  Not panicked.  With determination. EXT. SPACE STATION AIR LOCK - DAY The exterior air lock door slides open.  In agonizing, weightless slow motion Ben reaches to haul himself inside. The leading edge of the cloud hits: Ben is pelted by a hissing mass of space dust, splattering his suit with orange stains.  Larger particles, small pellets, pepper him.  Ben hauls himself in the last few feet by pulling on his tether. INT. SPACE STATION AIR LOCK/COMMAND CENTER - DAY

segments.content: Event threshold in ten seconds.

Johnny punches controls to close the exterior airlock door...

               Reed opens a first aid kit, grabs a thermo-elastic blanket...

heading.raw_text: INT. SPACE STATION - COMMAND CENTER/OBSERVATION DECK - SAME

segments.content:
Clutching the diamond ring, Victor stands defiantly.  Showing

               absolutely no concern for the others.  Interested only in the

               event itself.  Lights and equipment FALL, CRASHING around

               him.

               A control panel EXPLODES in Victor's face.  He jumps back,

               and into the falling equipment.  Collapses under the weight.

heading.raw_text: INT. SPACE STATION - AIR LOCK - SAME TIME

segments.content: Sue rounds a corner, sees Reed and Johnny.
Johnny!  Reed!

SLOW MOTION: Everyone frozen in position as:

               -- JOHNNY is hit with sparks of flame from a control panel.

               -- REED REACHES out for Ben and the airlock door.

               -- VAPOR STREAM pours down on Sue from a blown gasket.

               -- THE SPACE DUST burns into Ben's skin.

               SLOW MOTION: Just BEFORE the exterior air-lock door closes, a

               SINGLE PARTICLE zips through the narrowing gap and hits Ben

               in the back, ripping through his suit.  The exterior door

               shuts and seals.  The station loses all power.  DARKNESS.

As quickly as it came, the cloud passes on and whirls away,

               leaving the space station intact.  Power quietly flickers on. 

               Silence.  Time resumes.  All four pick up exactly where they

               left off, unaware of anything that just happened to them.

heading.raw_text: INT. SPACE STATION COMMAND CENTER - DAY

segments.content:
Victor emerges from the rubble.  He stands, checks his body. 

               A few scrapes, nothing serious.  A thin, throbbing CUT on his

               head.  He touches the wound, but it is not bleeding.

heading.raw_text: INT. SPACE STATION AIR LOCK - DAY

segments.content:
Reed and Johnny scramble to open the interior air lock door. 

               Sue joins them, as they pull Ben in.  They try to remove his

               helmet.  We don't see his face, but he's clearly unconscious.
He's not responsive --
INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY A BLACK SCREEN:

dialogue.text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY A BLACK SCREEN:

segments.content: SUBJECTIVE CAMERA, BEN'S POV: The blurry image of Johnny comes slowly into focus, standing beside a hospital bed.

dialogue.text: SUBJECTIVE CAMERA, BEN'S POV: The blurry image of Johnny comes slowly into focus, standing beside a hospital bed.

segments.content: Where...where am I?
Back on Earth.  Victor's medical
facility... We're in quarantine.
Reed? ... Sue?
They're fine.  Everybody else...is
fine.
Johnny looks away, as if he can't bear to lay eyes on him.
What's wrong with me?
I swear to you they've done everything
humanly possible.  The best plastic
surgeons in the world, Ben.  You had
the best --
Johnny picks up a hand mirror on the bed table before Ben can reach it, reluctant to give it to him.

dialogue.text: Johnny picks up a hand mirror on the bed table before Ben can reach it, reluctant to give it to him.

segments.content: They said that's not such a good idea,
the shock alone could --
Ben grabs it from him.  Then slowly raises it to look and see that...except for some serious stubble, Ben's totally normal.

character.name: Give me the god damn mirror!

dialogue.text: Ben grabs it from him.  Then slowly raises it to look and see that...except for some serious stubble, Ben's totally normal.

segments.content: Unfortunately, the doctors just
couldn't do anything to fix your face!
He cackles as he heads for the door.  Ben heaves the mirror
at him, breaking it into hundreds of pieces.  He turns to the
side-table, and grabs that picture of DEBBIE.  It calms him.

heading.raw_text: EXT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - ESTABLISHING - DAY

segments.content:
A modern facility of glass and stone, nestled in the forest. 

               In stark contrast to the lush greenery surrounding it.

locations: VON DOOM COMPOUND HOSPITAL CORRIDOR/SUE'S ROOM
heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND HOSPITAL CORRIDOR/SUE'S ROOM - DAY

segments.content:
Reed walks down the hall.  His hair is GRAYING at the

               temples.  He passes Johnny, who is smiling, still enjoying

               his joke on Ben.  Johnny slows, looking at Reed's hair.
Nice 'do.  Going for the "grandpa"
look?
Reed passes a mirror, slowing, seeing his gray hairs.  He
keeps going.  He passes a partially open door.  He stops when
he catches a glimpse of Sue asleep in bed.  He sees a vase of
flowers.  He grabs a couple lilies, and enters.
But Reed sees...the room is already FILLED with expensive
flowers.  All from VICTOR.  Reed is trumped once again.
A DOCTOR writes on Sue's chart.  A wall TV plays a press
conference with Victor, outside the FACILITY.  He looks worse
for wear.  A few hairs out of place, and a small BANDAGE on
his face.  We PUSH INTO the press conference --
You've been accused in the past of
moving science a little too fast --
Accused by who?  My competitors?
But surely this accident gives you
pause --
Danger is always part of discovery.
What would have happened if Ben
Franklin never went out in a storm?
Without risk, there's no reward.
So where's the reward?  You promised a
cure-all.
Victor pauses.  For the first time.  Just a flicker.
And you'll have it.  I've never come
up short.  And I'm not going to start
now.
So you're still taking VDI public --
Yes, of course.  I've never been more
confident in the compan--
Reed mutes the television.
How's she doing?
Reed takes the clipboard, looks for himself.

dialogue.text: Reed takes the clipboard, looks for himself.

segments.content: Blood panels show no irradiation.
Good.  You'll step up this protocol,
every --
Four hours.  We know what we're
doing... One more day of observation,
then you're all cleared.
The Doctor takes his clipboard, and walks out.  Reed steps to
Sue, with the drooping flowers in his hand.  Quiet:
WHOOSH.  A NURSE rolls in with a tray bearing ten more extravagant bouquets.  Reed looks resigned.  He walks out.

dialogue.text: WHOOSH.  A NURSE rolls in with a tray bearing ten more extravagant bouquets.  Reed looks resigned.  He walks out.

segments.content: She's allergic to orchids.  Put that
Amaryllis Apapathos by her bed.  The
African lilies?  They're her
favorites.
Reed exits, dropping his two wilted lilies into the trash.
Sue opens one eye, as the big lilies land by the bed.

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY

segments.content:
A SEXY NURSE wheels a testing station into Johnny's room. 

               He's stripped down to Calvins, changing into a ski outfit.
And where do we think we're going?
I don't know if "we've" noticed, but
the sickest runs this side of the Alps
are right outside that window --
I've noticed... But doctor's orders,
you're not allowed to leave until we --
Finish the tests, I know -- could you
give me a hand with this zipper?
You know this is not a ski resort.
Johnny opens the cardboard box, revealing a colorful fiberglass object the size of a briefcase.  In the blink of an eye, he unfolds it into a LONG SNOWBOARD.

dialogue.text: Johnny opens the cardboard box, revealing a colorful fiberglass object the size of a briefcase.  In the blink of an eye, he unfolds it into a LONG SNOWBOARD.

segments.content: Luckily grandma still sends care
packages.
The nurse pops a thermometer in his mouth to shut him up.
You are trouble.
(thermometer in his mouth)
They both pay more attention to his zipper than the digital read-out: it runs right up past 98.6, then accelerates fast.

dialogue.text: They both pay more attention to his zipper than the digital read-out: it runs right up past 98.6, then accelerates fast.

segments.content: You're hot!
So are you!
I mean, you feel a little feverish.
I've never felt better in my life.
When do you get off work?
My shift ends at four, but I couldn't --
Meet me at 4:01, top of the run.
That'll give you a minute to freshen
up.
He hands her the thermometer, a quick kiss and he's out the
door.  The machine beeps: Johnny's temperature is 209

heading.raw_text: EXT. VON DOOM COMPOUND HOSPITAL PATIO - DAY

segments.content:
Ben finds Reed on a patio with a panoramic view.  Reed works

               at a laptop computer.
How long was I out?
Three days.  I was worried about you.
How are you feeling?
Ben can see Reed doesn't look too solid.

dialogue.text: Ben can see Reed doesn't look too solid.

segments.content: Reed shakes his head, looking back at his screen.

dialogue.text: Reed shakes his head, looking back at his screen.

segments.content: I don't know.  I just keep going over
and over the numbers.
Reed.  Even you can't compute every
little thing.
I should have done more, run more
tests --
Ben gets closer, pushing down Reed's computer screen.
It was a freak of nature.  Last I
checked, you don't have a crystal
ball.  Let it go.
Reed considers.  But he can't let it go.  He opens his
computer back up, returning to work.  Ben shakes his head,
looks out at the view.  His eyes catch on something, wheels
turning.
You go through something like this,
makes you appreciate having the right
woman in your life.
Yeah, you and Debbie and perfect --
Reed follows Ben's eyes to a lower level patio: SUE.

character.name: Reed, I'm not talking about Debbie.

dialogue.text: Reed follows Ben's eyes to a lower level patio: SUE.

segments.content: What?  Come on.  She's got a good
thing with Victor --
I'm sorry, did that cosmic-bath loosen
your screws?
He's smart, powerful, successful --
Reed looks at Ben, resigned.

character.name: Well maybe you should date him.

dialogue.text: Reed looks at Ben, resigned.

segments.content: Ben.  He'll give her the life she
deserves.  She ended up with the right
guy.  Things worked out for the best.
Reed steps away.  Ben stands alone, an idea sparking.

INT. HELICOPTER/EXT. MOUNTAIN SUMMIT - DAY The chopper hovers over this pristine peak.  JOHNNY and his NURSE sit in the chopper-bay, prepping their ski gear. Johnny's customized snowboard has wild, acrylic patterns. His Nurse wears a hot pink cat-suit, her skis dangling out. Their bodies are close: a sexy, competitive flirtation.  They look down at a death-defying black diamond run.

character.name: Do I have to do everything myself?

dialogue.text: INT. HELICOPTER/EXT. MOUNTAIN SUMMIT - DAY The chopper hovers over this pristine peak.  JOHNNY and his NURSE sit in the chopper-bay, prepping their ski gear. Johnny's customized snowboard has wild, acrylic patterns. His Nurse wears a hot pink cat-suit, her skis dangling out. Their bodies are close: a sexy, competitive flirtation.  They look down at a death-defying black diamond run.

segments.content: Me like-y.
Stay right.  Left is trouble.
I though we went over this.
Last one down springs for room
service.
She pulls down her goggles, jumps out.  Johnny drops out
after her, hitting the snow.  He smolders: literally.  The
snow bank behind him sizzles and starts to melt.
He takes off after her and the chase is on:

The Nurse knows every inch of the trail, slicing expertly in

               and out of the trees through deep powder.  Johnny's a speed

               freak, maximizing velocity, closing the gap between them. 

               Ghostly FLAMES shoot off his hair: his ski cap catches fire,

               flies off.  Jets of fire knife through the back of his jacket.

               The Nurse looks back: In a burst of speed, Johnny draws even. 

               She looks over and sees the flames shooting out behind him...
You're on fire!
Not this again --

Johnny sees his gloves are burning, flicks them off in alarm. His body SHUDDERS: the back of his ski suit catches on fire. A burst of flame launches him down the slope like a rocket. Nurse loses concentration, falls.  Johnny races away like a missile, screaming in exhilaration.  He looks back -- no nurse. He tries to put out his flaming clothes, and accidentally VEERS to the LEFT.  He fails to notice the giant CHASM in front of him.  He faces forward and... SCREEAAMMS!  LAUNCHING off the cliff, LEGS FLAILING, trying to catch ground.  FLAMES begin to TRAIL his body as he FALLS towards the rocks below.  He tries to will his body away. Instead, his body becomes engulfed in flame.  He is a HUMAN TORCH!  And for a moment he HOLDS THE AIR -- the fire giving him some kind of...LIFT.  He maneuvers just over the rocks, almost making a 90 degree turn. He looks back at the rocks in disbelief.  But the lift doesn't last long. He quickly CRASHES, landing HARD into a snowbank. He opens his eyes; tries to move but can't.  He's trapped under snow and ice.  With all his strength, he tries to move, NO DICE.  Panic sets in. His eyes go wide as the snow around quickly begins to melt.  Johnny is on fire, and within seconds he's sitting in a small POND, steam rising from the water. The nurse races toward the steam.  Scared, panicked.  She finds Johnny...smiling, sitting naked in an impromptu hot tub, staring at his hands.  His body.  Exhilarated.

He tries to put out his flaming clothes, and accidentally VEERS to the LEFT.  He fails to notice the giant CHASM in front of him.  He faces forward and... SCREEAAMMS! Scared, panicked.  She finds Johnny...smiling, sitting naked in an impromptu hot tub, staring at his hands.  His body.  Exhilarated.

segments.content: She smiles and unzips.  The FLAMES DISSOLVE TO...CANDLES IN -- EXT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - VICTOR'S OFFICE - DAY On an expansive parapet with a billion-dollar view, Victor prepares a romantic dinner-setting as his staff scurry about. He checks every fork and knife, with a slightly manic energy.

dialogue.text: She smiles and unzips.  The FLAMES DISSOLVE TO...CANDLES IN -- EXT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - VICTOR'S OFFICE - DAY On an expansive parapet with a billion-dollar view, Victor prepares a romantic dinner-setting as his staff scurry about. He checks every fork and knife, with a slightly manic energy.

segments.content: How's the IPO?
Stable.  We're looking at low
twenties.  It's a good number,
considering the fallout from --
Reed's disaster.  You know, I half-
think he did this to me on purpose.
But Victor is on to the next thought, always strategizing.

character.name: Sir, I'm sure he wouldn't put himself --

dialogue.text: But Victor is on to the next thought, always strategizing.

segments.content: Get me on the AM shows, Larry King,
cover of the Journal...
(staring into silver tray)
I've got to do something about this
scar.  Make sure they only shoot my
right side.
Actually, uh, people seem to think the
scar "humanizes" you.
Victor looks at the scar, enraged by this defect.  It glistens in the silver tray.  His eyes are bloodshot, sleepless.

dialogue.text: Victor looks at the scar, enraged by this defect.  It glistens in the silver tray.  His eyes are bloodshot, sleepless.

segments.content: You know, maybe you should get some
rest --
Later.  First, I've got some
unfinished business.  A deal that
needs closing...
Leonard looks at the table, the lavish spread.  A beat.
Sir, I've always wondered... Why Sue?
You could have any woman in the world
but --
That's why.  Because I could have
any other woman... You know, when
they asked Caesar "why England," he
said, "because it's not mine."

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND DINING HALL - LATE AFTERNOON

segments.content:
Two dozen EMPLOYEES sit and eat.  Others serve themselves at

               the buffet.  Ben and Sue walking into the dining hall --
I can only stay for one drink, Ben.
I've got to meet with Victor.
They turn a corner and find Reed, entering by another door.

character.name: Wouldn't want to keep Vic waiting.

dialogue.text: They turn a corner and find Reed, entering by another door.

segments.content: Hey Reed, what are you doing here?
(before he can answer)
He quickly shepherds the two of them toward a quiet table. Ben's stomach GROWLS; so loud that they all can hear it.

character.name: Great, why don't you join us?

dialogue.text: He quickly shepherds the two of them toward a quiet table. Ben's stomach GROWLS; so loud that they all can hear it.

segments.content: God, I'm starving.  Gonna hit the
buffet.
Ben's stomach growls again, even louder this time.

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND DINING HALL - EVENING

segments.content:
The sun is long gone, and so are most of the diners.  The

               room is darker, more romantic.  Ben finishes the last shrimp

               on his plate, pushes it away, belches prodigiously.
Sue and Reed stare at him.  Ben's stomach growls again.

dialogue.text: Sue and Reed stare at him.  Ben's stomach growls again.

segments.content: Are you alright?
I think I need to lie down.  Bad
shrimp.
This was Ben's plan, but he really isn't feeling well,
unsteady when he walks away.  He looks down at his stomach.
ANGLE: Fireplace.  Sue looks gorgeous in the light.  A beat. A long beat.  Reed doesn't know where to start with this woman.

dialogue.text: ANGLE: Fireplace.  Sue looks gorgeous in the light.  A beat. A long beat.  Reed doesn't know where to start with this woman.

segments.content: Feeling better?
Yes, thanks.
That's good.  That's uh...good.
You always had a way with words.
(an awkward beat)
Sue gets up to leave.  Exasperated, Reed tries to think of something, anything, to say.

dialogue.text: Sue gets up to leave.  Exasperated, Reed tries to think of something, anything, to say.

segments.content: She slows down, looking at him.  She was hoping for more.

character.name: I'm really happy for you and Victor.

dialogue.text: She slows down, looking at him.  She was hoping for more.

segments.content: You're happy for me and Victor.
I can tell you guys are enjoying what
was the best part of our relationship --
Which was?
We see surprise on Sue's face, and...

dialogue.text: We see surprise on Sue's face, and...

segments.content: For science.
(frustrated)
You are such a dork, Reed... You never
got it and never will unless it's
explained to you in quantum physics.
As if triggered by her emotion, the fireplace light around
her BENDS.  The flames flicker in a ghostly breeze.
She looks more disappointed than angry.

dialogue.text: She looks more disappointed than angry.

segments.content: It's never what you say.  It's what
you don't say. What you don't do...
She lets that hang.  A lot of history here.  Quiet, hurt --
she wants Reed to fight for her, to show some emotion.
As Sue's emotions swirl, she slowly...disappears.

dialogue.text: As Sue's emotions swirl, she slowly...disappears.

segments.content: It's been two years, and all you can
say is you're happy for me and some
other guy...
(standing up, hurt)
You know, Victor may be a lot of
things, but at least he's not afraid
to fight for what he wants...
(Reed looks down)
And it's nice to be wanted sometimes.
To be heard...seen... Reed, look at
me.
He looks up...but all that's left of her is the blush on her
cheek and her bewitching eyes.  He drops his fork, shocked.
Uh, Sue...?  I can't.
What?  What do you mean you --

She raises her hands, but we don't see them.  We only see a medical waistband...floating.  Her watch...floating.  Her clothes appear to be suspended in mid-air. Sue is invisible.  She shrieks and gets up -- knocking a GLASS off the table... SLOW MOTION: The glass flies off the table, tumbling... Reed instinctively reaches for the bottle: his arm stretches two feet out of his sleeve -- grabs it just before it hits -- Then snaps back into place.  Reed stares at his arm in disbelief.  Sue's eyes widen as well.  The rest of Sue reappears.  They look at each other: mutual alarm.

dialogue.text: She raises her hands, but we don't see them.  We only see a medical waistband...floating.  Her watch...floating.  Her clothes appear to be suspended in mid-air. Sue is invisible.  She shrieks and gets up -- knocking a GLASS off the table... SLOW MOTION: The glass flies off the table, tumbling... Reed instinctively reaches for the bottle: his arm stretches two feet out of his sleeve -- grabs it just before it hits -- Then snaps back into place.  Reed stares at his arm in disbelief.  Sue's eyes widen as well.  The rest of Sue reappears.  They look at each other: mutual alarm.

segments.content: You guys will not believe what just
happened!
They look up to see JOHNNY in the doorway, NAKED except for
the nurse's PINK PARKA wrapped around his midsection.

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - VICTOR'S OFFICE - EARLY EVENING

segments.content:
CLUNK.  The candles burn low on the table.  Victor strides

               out, heading for the door.  He runs his hand through his hair

               to comb some strays.  A CLUMP comes off in his fingers.  He

               PAUSES.  He steps to a mirror, stares at his hair.  His SCAR. 

               It is longer than the bandage now (as if it SPREAD).  Victor

               peels back the bandage, and sees the scar is bluish-gray. 

               Deep, unhealthy, maybe infected...

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - HALLWAY - EARLY EVENING

segments.content:
DOUBLE DOORS burst open.  Reed, Sue, and Johnny urgently

               walk.
It has to be the cloud.  It's
fundamentally altered our DNA.
Let's not jump to conclusions, we need
a massive amount of evidence before
making that leap.
Reed glances over his shoulder.  He stares.  Sue follows his
gaze to see: Johnny's FINGERTIPS are on fire.  He SNAPS his
fingers.  They GO OUT.  He's totally unharmed.
Now what is up with that?
(deadpan)
The cloud has fundamentally altered
our DNA.
Cool.  What'd it do to you guys?
Apparently I can disappear.
Only one thing on Reed's mind --

character.name: Please tell me you go silent too.

dialogue.text: Only one thing on Reed's mind --

segments.content: EXT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - OUTSIDE BEN'S ROOM - EARLY EVENING Johnny snaps his fingers -- which generate small explosive bursts of flame.  He turns it on and off, like the "CLAPPER."

dialogue.text: EXT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - OUTSIDE BEN'S ROOM - EARLY EVENING Johnny snaps his fingers -- which generate small explosive bursts of flame.  He turns it on and off, like the "CLAPPER."

segments.content: Flame on, flame off.  Flame on, flame
off --
He does it again.  Flame on, flame off.

dialogue.text: He does it again.  Flame on, flame off.

segments.content: Stop it.
Reed's about to knock on Ben's door when he hears the banging, moaning and pleading inside.  Johnny smiles.

dialogue.text: Reed's about to knock on Ben's door when he hears the banging, moaning and pleading inside.  Johnny smiles.

segments.content: Oh, you dawg you.  Better not be my
nurse!

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - BEN'S ROOM - EARLY EVENING

segments.content: A creepy rippling movement begins beneath the sheet and gradually intensifies, reflected in the fabric's surface: the contours of Ben's body are changing, inflating, growing rough and craggy.  SOUND of grinding heavy rocks.

dialogue.text: A creepy rippling movement begins beneath the sheet and gradually intensifies, reflected in the fabric's surface: the contours of Ben's body are changing, inflating, growing rough and craggy.  SOUND of grinding heavy rocks.

segments.content: It all stops.  A beat, then all four legs of the bed give way and it crashes to the floor.  Under the covers, he groans in pain, and his voice is DEEPER, GRAVELY, but definitely CLEAR:

character.name: Open up Ben, we need to talk.

dialogue.text: It all stops.  A beat, then all four legs of the bed give way and it crashes to the floor.  Under the covers, he groans in pain, and his voice is DEEPER, GRAVELY, but definitely CLEAR:

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - OUTSIDE BEN'S ROOM - EARLY EVENING

segments.content:
Reed decides they can't wait any longer.  He kneels to the

               floor.  He concentrates, not sure if it will work...

               Suddenly, his arm STRETCHES, THIN ENOUGH TO CREEP UNDER THE

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - BEN'S ROOM - EARLY EVENING

segments.content:
Reed's arm wriggles under the door.  It bends upward, swiping

               clumsily, until it finally grabs the knob.  Rubbery fingers

               find the latch and unlock the door.

heading.raw_text: INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - OUTSIDE BEN'S ROOM - EARLY EVENING

segments.content:
Reed focuses, and pulls.  His arm snakes out from under the

               door and snaps back into place.  His flesh and bones

               reforming before their eyes.  Johnny stares at Reed.
They hear a tremendous SMASH from inside the room. INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - BEN'S ROOM - EARLY EVENING They open the door.  The room is trashed.  Every stick of furniture smashed to splinters.

dialogue.text: They hear a tremendous SMASH from inside the room. INT. VON DOOM COMPOUND - BEN'S ROOM - EARLY EVENING They open the door.  The room is trashed.  Every stick of furniture smashed to splinters.

segments.content: ...Ben?
Their eyes adjust; there's a huge hole where the window used
to be.  They rush to it.  Looking out they see SOMETHING
LARGE in the distance, running away.
What is that thing?
Reed looks out, emotions roiling.  Is that his best friend...?  Suddenly, Victor comes around the corner (bandage bigger).

character.name: I think that thing is Ben.

dialogue.text: Reed looks out, emotions roiling.  Is that his best friend...?  Suddenly, Victor comes around the corner (bandage bigger).

segments.content: What's going on?
He considers, but never shows weakness.  He nods.

dialogue.text: He considers, but never shows weakness.  He nods.

segments.content: Just a little banged up.  A couple
scrapes.  Why?
Ben did this.
Ben did this?
He's had some kind of...reaction to
exposure from the cloud.  And he's not
the only one.
Victor redirects his attention to Sue.

dialogue.text: Victor redirects his attention to Sue.

segments.content: Victor, I'm sorry I --
(cold)
Victor strides off, leaving the others.

dialogue.text: Victor strides off, leaving the others.

segments.content: Anybody know where the big guy's
going?
We PUSH IN on a picture of Debbie lying on the floor, Reed
knows exactly where Ben is going.

EXT. TRAIN YARD - NIGHT A view from Brooklyn: Manhattan glistens in the distance. CAMERA MOVES down to A TRAIN YARD, where we find empty cargo trains.  We PUSH IN on the main track, where... A CARGO TRAIN has just stopped.  We hear a cargo DOOR slide open, then WHUMP!  Big FEET hit the ground.  Someone, or someTHING barrels into the night. EXT. BIG & TALL SHOP - NIGHT A locked storefront on Flatbush Ave.  SOUND of breaking glass. INT. BIG & TALL SHOP - NIGHT SERIES OF SHOTS: Ben tries on clothes, shoes.  Jackets rip, shoes split.  He needs an extra extra extra large. EXT. PAY PHONE - NIGHT A HUGE FIGURE is huddled in shadow.  It's Ben. CLOSE ON: The dial pad.  Big fingers try to push keys but they're too large.  Ben tries for a few seconds, getting more and more frustrated.  He manages to press "0" with his pinky.

segments.content: Ben looks up the street, into the 2nd story window of a modest, working-class home.  His eyes go soft when he sees Debbie grab the phone.

dialogue.text: Ben looks up the street, into the 2nd story window of a modest, working-class home.  His eyes go soft when he sees Debbie grab the phone.

segments.content: Deb... It's me.  I need you to step
out front.
Out front?  You home, baby?  I got
a surprise for you.
He blinks hard.  Sad, dark.
EXT. BROOKLYN HOUSE - NIGHT Debbie steps out.  There is "WELCOME HOME" sign over the door.  She looks out.  The wind blows softly.  Something shifts in the darkness.  Debbie pulls her robe tighter.

character.name: I got a surprise for you too.

dialogue.text: EXT. BROOKLYN HOUSE - NIGHT Debbie steps out.  There is "WELCOME HOME" sign over the door.  She looks out.  The wind blows softly.  Something shifts in the darkness.  Debbie pulls her robe tighter.

segments.content: Ben?
Don't come any closer for a sec.  This
is gonna be kind of a shock... You
remember when we said "together
forever no matter what"?

A hanging beat.  And Ben...steps into the light, where we SEE HIM FOR THE FIRST TIME: he's HUGE, easily twice the size he once was, and AN ORANGY ROCKY SURFACE COVERS HIS ENTIRE BODY. Debbie sees him.  Fear washes over her, not sure what to think.  He reaches out, a little tentative.  She flinches back.

dialogue.text: A hanging beat.  And Ben...steps into the light, where we SEE HIM FOR THE FIRST TIME: he's HUGE, easily twice the size he once was, and AN ORANGY ROCKY SURFACE COVERS HIS ENTIRE BODY. Debbie sees him.  Fear washes over her, not sure what to think.  He reaches out, a little tentative.  She flinches back.

segments.content: Oh my G-g-g.  What did you...do to
Ben?

He reaches out.  She recoils.  It's too much for her.  Tears swell in her eyes.  Covering her mouth, she backs away. He takes a step closer.  She backs away faster, tripping over her robe, falling into the street.  A car screeches to a halt.  Ben instinctively steps out to help, but she scurries back.

character.name: Deb, it's me.  It's still me.

dialogue.text: He reaches out.  She recoils.  It's too much for her.  Tears swell in her eyes.  Covering her mouth, she backs away. He takes a step closer.  She backs away faster, tripping over her robe, falling into the street.  A car screeches to a halt.  Ben instinctively steps out to help, but she scurries back.

segments.content: Her shout wakes NEIGHBORS.  Lights flicker on.  Ben knows he has to go.  He looks at Debbie, sensing this is the last time he'll see her.  She trembles, terrified.  His eyes go moist.

dialogue.text: Her shout wakes NEIGHBORS.  Lights flicker on.  Ben knows he has to go.  He looks at Debbie, sensing this is the last time he'll see her.  She trembles, terrified.  His eyes go moist.

segments.content: With that, he turns away.  The "WELCOME HOME" sign flutters, falls to the ground.  A tragic tableau.  As more lights go on around him, Ben picks up his pace, speeding into the dawn. INT. VICTOR'S COMPOUND OFFICE - DAY Victor packs a monogrammed Armani briefcase: "VDM" emblazoned on a gold plate.  Leonard waits not-so-patiently.

segments.content: Make sure you find Ben, bring him back
here.  And keep it quiet.  I don't
need this to hit the press.
Yes sir.  You've got the Mayor at
eight, then a nine-thirty interview
with the Journal --
Front page?
Top left, like you asked.
(a smile)
Today Wall Street.  Tomorrow, who
knows...maybe Washington.
Victor turns to Leonard, disappointed with him.

EXT. BROOKLYN BRIDGE - DAY We swoop toward this epic monument.  On a steel girder above the road, we see...a STATUE.  BEN.  He sits on the edge of the beams, staring down at the river below, brooding, muttering.

dialogue.text: EXT. BROOKLYN BRIDGE - DAY We swoop toward this epic monument.  On a steel girder above the road, we see...a STATUE.  BEN.  He sits on the edge of the beams, staring down at the river below, brooding, muttering.

segments.content: A few days in space, it'll be great,
what's the worst that could happen?
A PIGEON flutters past him, and drops a white gooey gift on
his shoulder.  Ben just glares up at the heavens.

He hears the sound of someone SOBBING.  He turns to see...a distraught BUSINESSMAN with a briefcase.  The man drops his case, which PLUMMETS hundreds-of-feet into the RIVER. The Businessman looks out, ready to jump.  He doesn't see Ben (or doesn't realize Ben is not a statue).

dialogue.text: He hears the sound of someone SOBBING.  He turns to see...a distraught BUSINESSMAN with a briefcase.  The man drops his case, which PLUMMETS hundreds-of-feet into the RIVER. The Businessman looks out, ready to jump.  He doesn't see Ben (or doesn't realize Ben is not a statue).

segments.content: You think you got trouble?  Take a
good look, pal, how bad could it be?
The Businessman looks at Ben, terrified.  Ben steps forward.

Backpedaling, the man SLIPS, FALLING toward the ROADWAY!  His arms flail, grabbing a narrow beam -- his fingers hold tight while his legs thrash over speeding traffic.  Cars and trucks SKIM right underfoot.  Ben shakes his head.

dialogue.text: Backpedaling, the man SLIPS, FALLING toward the ROADWAY!  His arms flail, grabbing a narrow beam -- his fingers hold tight while his legs thrash over speeding traffic.  Cars and trucks SKIM right underfoot.  Ben shakes his head.

segments.content: Ben steps out to help, but...his WEIGHT BENDS the beam!  The Businessman LOSES HIS GRIP!  He FALLS TO THE ROAD, landing hard on the highway!  A few PEDESTRIANS see Ben.  They point. Ben looks up, deer in headlights.  He sees a massive TRUCK bearing down on the Businessman.

character.name: You had to choose my spot, didn't you?

dialogue.text: Ben steps out to help, but...his WEIGHT BENDS the beam!  The Businessman LOSES HIS GRIP!  He FALLS TO THE ROAD, landing hard on the highway!  A few PEDESTRIANS see Ben.  They point. Ben looks up, deer in headlights.  He sees a massive TRUCK bearing down on the Businessman.

segments.content: Ben DROPS to the street.  WHOOMPF!  He lands in front of the Businessman, SWEEPS him out of the way with one arm, and turns to the oncoming 18 WHEELER CAB. The DRIVER slams his brakes, eyes wide.  The truck SWERVES, but cannot stop!  Time slows to syrup, as Ben looks a little scared.  He shuts his eyes, and... SHOULDER-BLOCKS the INCOMING TRUCK!  A football move.  The truck BUCKLES, POPPING a WHEELIE, CRUMPLING all the way to the windshield!  It looks like a metal car-compactor. The truck SWERVES hard, its tail SMASHING into steel girders. CARS SCREECH, SWERVE, SLAMMING INTO EACH OTHER, CAUSING A FOUR-LANE TRAFFIC ACCIDENT!  Windows shatter, fires flicker. One of the cars in an NYPD CRUISER.  COPS clamber out. EXT. CAB ON HIGHWAY - DAY Reed, Johnny, and Sue sit in the back.  They see the action on the bridge.  Reed and Sue lock eyes, sensing the worst. EXT. BROOKLYN BRIDGE - DAY Ben stands in the middle of the chaos, staring at the destruction.  He sees the tow-truck DRIVER bleeding, trapped in his cab.  Ben moves to this burning hunk of steel. He SWIPES through the shattered window, and PUNCHES the airbag, POPPING it like a kid's balloon.  He tries to grab the seat-belt, but his fingers are TOO BIG.  He struggles.

character.name: This is really not my day.

segments.content: A little help here?!  You wanna hit
that button, sir?
The driver is too woozy.  Ben can't get to the button.
Frustrated, he simply TEARS OFF THE DOOR, and RIPS THE
DRIVER'S SEAT right out of the cab!  COPS round the corner.
They see Ben holding onto the Driver.  They raise their guns.

heading.raw_text: FREEZE!  PUT THE MAN AND THE SEAT

segments.content:
realizes how this must look -- a monster holding a bloody man

               in hand.

At the back of the traffic jam, cars SCREECH to stops.  The

               whole bridge is FULL of bumper-to-bumper traffic.  We PUSH

               TOWARD one car: three doors pop open, and out come...

               REED, JOHNNY, SUE.  They look through smoke and mayhem to

               see...their first full look at Ben.  Reed stands gutpunched.

EXT. BROOKLYN BRIDGE - DAY Ben puts the seat down, with the Driver on it.  He lunges behind a truck.  The cops try to follow, but FLAMES push them back.  Ben lurches away, head down, self-conscious. He tries to hide from ONLOOKERS around him and PEDESTRIANS on walkways overhead.  He wants to escape, but hears SCREAMING MOTORISTS.  He grits his teeth, and moves to help them. EXT. BROOKLYN BRIDGE - GRIDLOCK - DAY Reed, Sue, and Johnny race toward the flames.  All other people head in the OPPOSITE DIRECTION.  BRIDGE POLICE herd the crowd away from the accident.

BRIDGE POLICE herd the crowd away from the accident.

segments.content: Reed, Sue, and Johnny slow down, swap glances.

dialogue.text: Reed, Sue, and Johnny slow down, swap glances.

segments.content: MOVE IN ON REED.  A first test of leadership.  But he is not a leader.  Not yet.  Sue gets closer to him.

character.name: What now?  Reed...?  What do we do?

dialogue.text: MOVE IN ON REED.  A first test of leadership.  But he is not a leader.  Not yet.  Sue gets closer to him.

segments.content: Ben's out there.  Let's go get him.
Maybe you didn't hear me.  Those cars
are gonna blow sky high, any second.
Look, we've got a friend out there in
trouble.  We need to get to him before --
A hard beat.  Reed signals Sue with a look, a nod.
What?
(mutters)
He motions to her body.  She understands.  She concentrates, and starts to turn invisible.

character.name: We need to get past them.

dialogue.text: He motions to her body.  She understands.  She concentrates, and starts to turn invisible.

segments.content: But her clothes don't go invisible.  Beat.  Reed mutters:

character.name: What the hell is this?  A magic show?

dialogue.text: But her clothes don't go invisible.  Beat.  Reed mutters:

segments.content: Sue.  Your clothes.  Lose them.
What...?
(realizes)

She unbuttons her blouse.  Not thrilled with the idea.  She wriggles out of her pants.  Down to her skivvies.  She reaches back to undo her bra...momentarily loses concentration and becomes visible.  The sight of Sue in her undies grabs the COPS' attention.  Everyone watches, stunned. The realization that she's visible hits her like a ton of bricks.  Cops are transfixed.  So is Reed.

The realization that she's visible hits her like a ton of bricks.  Cops are transfixed.  So is Reed.

segments.content: This is wrong in so many ways.
You've been working out.
Sue takes a deep breath.  Closes her eyes.  Focuses.  Nothing happens.  She's embarrassed and furious.

dialogue.text: Sue takes a deep breath.  Closes her eyes.  Focuses.  Nothing happens.  She's embarrassed and furious.

segments.content: Any more ideas, Reed?  Maybe you
should strip down next, see how it
feels to have fifty people staring --
...and she DISAPPEARS.  Entirely.  Undies float.  Jaws drop.
She stops ranting.  Realizes she's gone invisible.

dialogue.text: She stops ranting.  Realizes she's gone invisible.

segments.content: The undies drop.  The cops stare open-mouthed.  They turn to look at Reed, astonished.  He sheepishly shrugs his shoulders.

He tries to see over a big TRUCK, and his neck STREEETCHES! He finally sees...BEN.  Reed wraps around a car, and...BOO! His face snakes right in front of Ben.  Ben jumps.

He tries to see over a big TRUCK, and his neck STREEETCHES! He finally sees...BEN.  Reed wraps around a car, and...BOO! His face snakes right in front of Ben.  Ben jumps.

segments.content: What the --!
Ben.  Are you okay?
He motions to Reed's neck.  Then to his own body:

character.name: Am I okay?!  You wanna explain that?!

dialogue.text: He motions to Reed's neck.  Then to his own body:

segments.content: Or this?!  What the hell am I? 'Cause
Reed opens his mouth, but he has no answer.  Not yet.

dialogue.text: Reed opens his mouth, but he has no answer.  Not yet.

segments.content:
Ben spins, looking for Sue.  He can't see her.  But he does

               see...A CAR INCHES AWAY, WITH GAS TANK FLAMING!

               BOOOOM!  The first car BLOWS!  BOOOM!BOOOOM!BOOOOOM!  Empty

               cars BLOW in a chain-reaction.  The flames are mushrooming! 

               Reed SWIPES his ARMS OUT, holding people back.  His arms

               FLATTEN to form a barricade -- FACES INDENT his skin.

               FLAMES lash out.  A pack of attractive YOUNG WOMEN scream. 

               Johnny LEAPS toward them.  His feet LEAVE THE GROUND, giving

               him extra lift.  He SPINS, lands, and embraces the women,

               SHIELDING them from flames which burn up his back.  He looks

               the ladies up and down, and gives a cheesy smile.

               Sue SCREAMS.  She puts her hands up (a normal reflex).  The

               air seems to RIPPLE around her hands, like FORCE-FIELDS.

               She looks at them, surprised, confused.  Her invisible fields

               SPIRAL OUT, partially CONTAINING the blast.  But the flames

               hurtle closer.  She fights the pressure.  Blood trickles from

               her nose.  Just as the white hot blast is about to hit her... 

               Sue is dressed again.  Visible.  She SCREAMS, and PUSHES THE

               FORCE DOWN INTO THE ROAD!  She collapses, as the blast

               deflects off the street and into...

               An oncoming FIRETRUCK!  BOOOOM!  The firetruck is KNOCKED OFF

               THE GROUND, SLEWING SIDEWAYS.  Brakes scream.  Its tail

               slashes out, PUNCHING through the guard-rail.

heading.subject: S OUT, HUNDREDS OF FEET ABOVE THE
heading.raw_text: THE BACK OF THE TRUCK DANGLES OUT, HUNDREDS OF FEET ABOVE THE

segments.content:
WATER!  FIREMEN hang off the back and sides.  The truck

               TEETERS, falling!  Ben wastes no time.  He GRABS onto the

               front of the truck, just as it goes off the side!

               He DIGS his heels into the ground, but his feet DRAG across

               the concrete, digging grooves into the street.

               ON THE DANGLING FIRETRUCK: FIREMEN climb out, clawing toward

               the bridge.  Their truck SWINGS.  Bits and pieces tumble down

               at them -- a hose, an axe, a helmet.  All deadly now.  The

               HANGING LADDER swoops down, with men RIDING ON IT!

               Ben SCREAMS!  STRAINING with all his might.  Ben SCREAMS! 

               His muscles ripple, and...he takes his first step...back. 

               Another scream.  Another step.  Another.  Another.  Epic,

               painful.

               He is pulling the truck back onto the bridge, inch by inch. 

               His footsteps THUD.  With monumental effort, he levels the

               truck.  Firemen scurry over hoses and ladders, some climbing

               over Ben.

               Reed tends to Sue who has fainted from her effort.  Ben steps

               back from the truck and slumps to the street exhausted.  Wary

               cops close in to cover him with weapons, but...

               The FIREMEN slowly begin to APPLAUD.  The crowd of onlookers

               joins in as well.  Sue, Reed, and Johnny seem surprised,

               touched by the reaction.  But Ben seems uncomfortable. 

               Firemen step forward to offer Reed a couple of their coats;

               he hands one to Johnny and uses the other to cover Sue.

Ben sees a familiar face in the masses: DEBBIE.  Ben steps

               toward her, but she stops him with a look.  She places

               something on the ground and runs off into the crowd.

               Ben sees something GLISTENING on the ground.  He stoops over

               to pick up...her ENGAGEMENT RING.  His big fingers can't grip

               it.  He tries in vain.  Hopeless, pathetic.  A beat.  And... 

               A hand grabs the ring.  It's Reed.  Quiet, close.
I swear to you, I will do everything
in my power until there is not a
breath left in me: you are going to be

Off the wounded look in Ben's eyes, wanting to believe him... INT. VICTOR'S OFFICE - DAY Victor sits with remote in hand, staring at his plasma TV. Fifty cameras flash.  The field is full of press.  Our heroes freeze, shocked by the crowd. Johnny eats up the attention.  Ben turns, self-conscious. Reed notices.  The Chief Fireman turns to them.

Uh, during our recent mission to the
Von Doom space station, we were

kind of nucleotide compoun--

What happened on the bridge?  Does it

Working on it.  And it's a lot harder --
We don't know much more than you do,

And we are gonna blow your minds.
There's a new day dawning.  The day of

The Reporter nods toward Ben.  Ben's fists tighten, the sound of rocks crushing together.  Reed feels the pain.

Reporters laugh.  Ben turns his head away.  Reed burns.
Look, we went up to space to find a

our DNA, our disease, our lives on the

Reed, Sue, and Ben get up to go.  The press waits a beat, then surges.  Ben spins, holding up one finger.  A giant.

Victor's grip tightens around the table, and...the LAPTOPS

Victor looks down at his hands -- a private beat (did I do

(pointed)
I really appreciate all your support.

Victor looks at him, blood boiling, and we CUT HARD TO -- INT. BANK - HALLWAY - DAY Victor and Leonard stride out.  Victor is writhing.

Leonard is thinking all business.
Sir.  Reed's comments at that press
conference killed us.  How are we
going to turn this around?
Victor considers.  His mind races, eyes narrow.
Very simple.  I cure them.  If I can
cure these freaks, then I can cure
anyone.  What better way to restore my
reputation?
Leonard nods, impressed.  Victor is a man in motion.  As they
step into sunlight, we cut to...CLICKCLICKCLICK in --

Give 'em your good side.  Or your less

A digital readout on the panel: EXCEED MAXIMUM WEIGHT.  A

That's what we're here to find out.
If it happened to him, then it
could...
Happen to all of them.  Reed nods softly.
Wait.  You mean there's chance we

Grow up, Johnny.  You want to run

The elevator opens.  They step out.  They might be on the

We should stay here until we can
define the extent of our changes...
This place is deluxe.  You got cable?

...and figure out how to reverse them.

This time, the press pay no attention to him. No cameras flash.  Victor tightens, and enters the building. INT. SUE'S ROOM - DAY Sue walks out of the bathroom in a robe, drying her hair. She notices a familiar book on a shelf: a SCRAPBOOK. She flips through it.  It's filled with pictures of Reed and his inventions -- a lot less fancy than Victor's multimedia globe.  She stops at a picture of her and Reed in COLLEGE. A noise, and she turns, flinching slightly, surprised to see...VICTOR.  He smiles, standing at the door, watching her.

character.name: Let me show you to your rooms.

segments.content: Victor, your scar --
I told you, I'm fine.  It's you I'm

I'm sorry I didn't get a chance to --
Please, no apologies.  I've arranged

my condos.  You'll have round-the
